WRITING.TITLE: IJW: The Untouchables (1987)
WRITING.TEXT:
I had heard about the movie for years from friends and family who had seen it, and those who told me that I, a major history buff, would like the accuracy of it.
Holy cow, that movie was corny.
The thing that first got me was soundtrack. The theme that plays during the opening credits sounds like the theme of an old horror movie, and the rest was nothing but excessively upbeat scores, which, to me, didn't fit in a movie about the group of cops that brought down Al Capone.
Secondly, the performances felt very cartoonish, especially Robert Di Nero's Al Capone and Sean Connery.
Third, as a Native Chicagoan, I was kind of disappointed the film didn't show more of the city.
I realize that I'm criticizing a movie that's 30 or more years old, but having not seen it before, I was surprised at how different it was from what I thought it would be.

WRITING.TITLE: [ME:A spoilers] Weapons in Andromeda
WRITING.TEXT:
In a lot of ways, Bioware made a ton of improvements in regards to weapons and armor in Andromeda. I especially love the small details they made with the sound effects and reload animations for weapons and the overall designs for the armor. However, after completing several playthroughs, I've noticed several things I think that can be improved upon in future Andromeda titles:
1. Better modification: I think Andromeda had a much better weapon mod system compared to those in the OT. However, I felt that it wasn't as in depth as it could have been, especially when it comes to the selection of mods to choose from, as a majority of them look the same and provide the same kind of bonuses in terms of stats. In an Andromeda sequel, I would like to see a wider variety of scopes, barrels, receivers, and underbarrels from different factions and with their own visual style(What would an anagran scope look like on a Milky Way weapon for example) I would also like to see things like bayonets from ME3 make a return. Additionally I would like to see Andromeda adopt a system similar to the Gunsmith System from the Ghost Recon games where you can see the mods going on and off your weapon.
2. Melee weapon variety/executions: In regards to the melee weapons in Andromeda, I like that we weren't stuck the Omni-blade and had the option to Asari swords Krogan hammers, but I would have like to used Agaran daggers or Turian combat knives or different omni weapons. I would have also liked to have seen execution animations like what Gears of War 4 had with the combat knife.
3. Weapon visuals: I think everyone was hoping to be able to customize the look of their weapon. Can you imagine an Assault Rifle in the color of the Initiative or a shotgun with Angaran markings engraved on it?
4. I really liked the inclusion of heavy weapons in ME2, and I hope they come back. Who wouldn't want to wield an Angaran or Kett grenade launcher or a minigun fashioned from Rem-tech.
